blocks.name: onomeneq
blocks.content: An ordinal number equinumerous to a natural number is equal to it. Proposition 10.22 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 90 and its converse. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jul-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm onomeneq(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wb(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wceq(c0, c1)))
} = {
  impbid(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wceq(c0, c1))
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wceq(c0, c1))
  sylancom(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wceq(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)))
  jca(wa(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com))
  mpbird(wa(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wcel(c0, com), wn(wss(com, c0)))
  mtod(wa(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wss(com, c0), wbr(c0, cen, csuc(c1)))
  mtbird(wa(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wbr(c0, cen, csuc(c1)), wbr(c1, cen, csuc(c1)))
  ad2antlr(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wn(wbr(c1, cen, csuc(c1))))
  php5(c1)
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wb(wbr(c0, cen, csuc(c1)), wbr(c1, cen, csuc(c1))))
  enen1(c0, c1, csuc(c1))
  syl6(wa(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wss(com, c0), wbr(c0, cen, csuc(c1)), wa(wbr(c0, cdom, csuc(c1)), wbr(csuc(c1), cdom, c0)))
  jcad(wa(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wss(com, c0), wbr(c0, cdom, csuc(c1)), wbr(csuc(c1), cdom, c0))
  adantll(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wi(wss(com, c0), wbr(c0, cdom, csuc(c1))))
  a1d(wa(wcel(c1, com), wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wss(com, c0), wbr(c0, cdom, csuc(c1)))
  ancoms(wcel(c1, com), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wbr(c0, cdom, csuc(c1)))
  sylan2(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, com), wbr(c0, cdom, csuc(c1)), wbr(c1, cdom, csuc(c1)))
  mpisyl(wcel(c1, com), wbr(c1, cdom, csuc(c1)), wcel(csuc(c1), com), wss(c1, csuc(c1)))
  peano2(c1)
  sssucid(c1)
  ssdomg(csuc(c1), com, c1)
  endomtr(c0, c1, csuc(c1))
  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wi(wss(com, c0), wbr(csuc(c1), cdom, c0)))
  ancoms(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(com, c0), wbr(csuc(c1), cdom, c0)))
  syld(wa(wcel(c1, com), wcel(c0, con0)), wss(com, c0), wbr(csuc(c1), cdom, c0), wss(csuc(c1), c0))
  sylibd(wa(wcel(c1, com), wcel(c0, con0)), wss(com, c0), wss(csuc(c1), c0), wcel(c1, c0))
  adantr(wcel(c1, com), wcel(c0, con0), wi(wss(com, c0), wcel(c1, c0)))
  com12(wcel(c1, com), wss(com, c0), wcel(c1, c0))
  ssel(com, c0, c1)
  sylan2(wcel(c1, com), wcel(c0, con0), wb(wcel(c1, c0), wss(csuc(c1), c0)), word(c0))
  ordelsuc(c1, com, c0)
  adantl(wcel(c1, com), wcel(c0, con0), wi(wss(csuc(c1), c0), wbr(csuc(c1), cdom, c0)))
  ssdomg(c0, con0, csuc(c1))
  sbth(c0, csuc(c1))
  ad2antrr(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wb(wcel(c0, com), wn(wss(com, c0))))
  con2bid(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c0, com), wss(com, c0))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, con0), wb(wss(com, c0), wn(wcel(c0, com))), word(com), word(c0))
  ordom()
  eloni(c0)
  ordtri1(com, c0)
  simplr(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com), wbr(c0, cen, c1))
  biimpa(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wceq(c0, c1))
  nneneq(c0, c1)
  adantr(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, com), wi(wceq(c0, c1), wbr(c0, cen, c1)))
  eqeng(c0, con0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm onomeneq(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om)‚Üí(c0[‚âÖ]c1 ‚Üî c0 = c1))
} = {
  impbid((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om), c0[‚âÖ]c1, c0 = c1)
  ex((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om), c0[‚âÖ]c1, c0 = c1)
  sylancom((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om), c0[‚âÖ]c1, c0 = c1, (c0 ‚àà _om ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om))
  jca(((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om)‚àß c0[‚âÖ]c1), c0 ‚àà _om, c1 ‚àà _om)
  mpbird(((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om)‚àß c0[‚âÖ]c1), c0 ‚àà _om, ¬¨ _om ‚äÜ c0)
  mtod(((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om)‚àß c0[‚âÖ]c1), _om ‚äÜ c0, c0[‚âÖ]suc(c1))
  mtbird(((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om)‚àß c0[‚âÖ]c1), c0[‚âÖ]suc(c1), c1[‚âÖ]suc(c1))
  ad2antlr(c0 ‚àà On, c1 ‚àà _om, c0[‚âÖ]c1, ¬¨ c1[‚âÖ]suc(c1))
  php5(c1)
  adantl((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om), c0[‚âÖ]c1, (c0[‚âÖ]suc(c1)‚Üî c1[‚âÖ]suc(c1)))
  enen1(c0, c1, suc(c1))
  syl6(((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om)‚àß c0[‚âÖ]c1), _om ‚äÜ c0, c0[‚âÖ]suc(c1), (c0[‚âº]suc(c1)‚àß suc(c1)[‚âº]c0))
  jcad(((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om)‚àß c0[‚âÖ]c1), _om ‚äÜ c0, c0[‚âº]suc(c1), suc(c1)[‚âº]c0)
  adantll(c0 ‚àà On, c1 ‚àà _om, c0[‚âÖ]c1, (_om ‚äÜ c0 ‚Üí c0[‚âº]suc(c1)))
  a1d((c1 ‚àà _om ‚àß c0[‚âÖ]c1), _om ‚äÜ c0, c0[‚âº]suc(c1))
  ancoms(c1 ‚àà _om, c0[‚âÖ]c1, c0[‚âº]suc(c1))
  sylan2(c0[‚âÖ]c1, c1 ‚àà _om, c0[‚âº]suc(c1), c1[‚âº]suc(c1))
  mpisyl(c1 ‚àà _om, c1[‚âº]suc(c1), suc(c1)‚àà _om, c1 ‚äÜ suc(c1))
  peano2(c1)
  sssucid(c1)
  ssdomg(suc(c1), com, c1)
  endomtr(c0, c1, suc(c1))
  adantr((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om), c0[‚âÖ]c1, (_om ‚äÜ c0 ‚Üí suc(c1)[‚âº]c0))
  ancoms(c0 ‚àà On, c1 ‚àà _om, (_om ‚äÜ c0 ‚Üí suc(c1)[‚âº]c0))
  syld((c1 ‚àà _om ‚àß c0 ‚àà On), _om ‚äÜ c0, suc(c1)[‚âº]c0, suc(c1)‚äÜ c0)
  sylibd((c1 ‚àà _om ‚àß c0 ‚àà On), _om ‚äÜ c0, suc(c1)‚äÜ c0, c1 ‚àà c0)
  adantr(c1 ‚àà _om, c0 ‚àà On, (_om ‚äÜ c0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c0))
  com12(c1 ‚àà _om, _om ‚äÜ c0, c1 ‚àà c0)
  ssel(com, c0, c1)
  sylan2(c1 ‚àà _om, c0 ‚àà On, (c1 ‚àà c0 ‚Üî suc(c1)‚äÜ c0), Ord(c0))
  ordelsuc(c1, com, c0)
  adantl(c1 ‚àà _om, c0 ‚àà On, (suc(c1)‚äÜ c0 ‚Üí suc(c1)[‚âº]c0))
  ssdomg(c0, con0, suc(c1))
  sbth(c0, suc(c1))
  ad2antrr(c0 ‚àà On, c1 ‚àà _om, c0[‚âÖ]c1, (c0 ‚àà _om ‚Üî ¬¨ _om ‚äÜ c0))
  con2bid(c0 ‚àà On, c0 ‚àà _om, _om ‚äÜ c0)
  sylancr(c0 ‚àà On, (_om ‚äÜ c0 ‚Üî ¬¨ c0 ‚àà _om), Ord(_om), Ord(c0))
  ordom()
  eloni(c0)
  ordtri1(com, c0)
  simplr(c0 ‚àà On, c1 ‚àà _om, c0[‚âÖ]c1)
  biimpa((c0 ‚àà _om ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om), c0[‚âÖ]c1, c0 = c1)
  nneneq(c0, c1)
  adantr(c0 ‚àà On, c1 ‚àà _om, (c0 = c1 ‚Üí c0[‚âÖ]c1))
  eqeng(c0, con0, c1)
}

blocks.name: onfin
blocks.content: An ordinal number is finite iff it is a natural number. Proposition 10.32 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 92. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jul-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm onfin(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, con0), wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c0, com)))
} = {
  syl5bb(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c0, com), wrex(hs0, com, wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0))))
  isfi(hs0, c0)
  impbid1(wcel(c0, con0), wrex(hs0, com, wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0))), wcel(c0, com))
  rexlimdva(hs0, com, wcel(c0, con0), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wcel(c0, com))
  sylbid(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), com)), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wcel(c0, com), wceq(c0, cv(hs0)))
  onomeneq(c0, cv(hs0))
  adantl(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), com), wi(wceq(c0, cv(hs0)), wcel(c0, com)))
  eleq1a(cv(hs0), com, c0)
  mpdan(wcel(c0, com), wrex(hs0, com, wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0))), wbr(c0, cen, c0))
  enrefg(c0, com)
  rspcev(hs0, c0, com, wbr(c0, cen, c0), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c0, c0, cen)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, con0))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, com))
  diff.hs0.c(com)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c0, cen, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm onfin(class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà On ‚Üí(c0 ‚àà Fin ‚Üî c0 ‚àà _om))
} = {
  syl5bb(c0 ‚àà On, c0 ‚àà Fin, c0 ‚àà _om, ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà _om, c0[‚âÖ]hs0))
  isfi(hs0, c0)
  impbid1(c0 ‚àà On, ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà _om, c0[‚âÖ]hs0), c0 ‚àà _om)
  rexlimdva(hs0, com, c0 ‚àà On, c0[‚âÖ]hs0, c0 ‚àà _om)
  sylbid((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß hs0 ‚àà _om), c0[‚âÖ]hs0, c0 ‚àà _om, c0 = hs0)
  onomeneq(c0, hs0)
  adantl(c0 ‚àà On, hs0 ‚àà _om, (c0 = hs0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà _om))
  eleq1a(hs0, com, c0)
  mpdan(c0 ‚àà _om, ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà _om, c0[‚âÖ]hs0), c0[‚âÖ]c0)
  enrefg(c0, com)
  rspcev(hs0, c0, com, c0[‚âÖ]c0, c0[‚âÖ]hs0)
  breq2(hs0, c0, c0, cen)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ‚àà On)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ‚àà _om)
  diff.hs0.c(com)
  diff.hs0.w(c0[‚âÖ]c0)
}

blocks.name: onfin2
blocks.content: A set is a natural number iff it is a finite ordinal. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jan-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm onfin2() {
  |- wceq(com, cin(con0, cfn))
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, com, cin(con0, cfn))
  bitr4i(wcel(cv(hs0), com), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(con0, cfn)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn)))
  impbii(wcel(cv(hs0), com), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn)))
  jcai(wcel(cv(hs0), com), wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  nnon(cv(hs0))
  biimprcd(wcel(cv(hs0), com), wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  biimpa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wcel(cv(hs0), com))
  onfin(cv(hs0))
  elin(cv(hs0), con0, cfn)
  diff.hs0.c(com)
  diff.hs0.c(cin(con0, cfn))
}

thm onfin2() {
  ‚ä¢ _om =(On ‚ãÇ Fin)
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, com, (On ‚ãÇ Fin))
  bitr4i(hs0 ‚àà _om, hs0 ‚àà(On ‚ãÇ Fin), (hs0 ‚àà On ‚àß hs0 ‚àà Fin))
  impbii(hs0 ‚àà _om, (hs0 ‚àà On ‚àß hs0 ‚àà Fin))
  jcai(hs0 ‚àà _om, hs0 ‚àà On, hs0 ‚àà Fin)
  nnon(hs0)
  biimprcd(hs0 ‚àà _om, hs0 ‚àà On, hs0 ‚àà Fin)
  biimpa(hs0 ‚àà On, hs0 ‚àà Fin, hs0 ‚àà _om)
  onfin(hs0)
  elin(hs0, con0, cfn)
  diff.hs0.c(com)
  diff.hs0.c((On ‚ãÇ Fin))
}

blocks.name: nnfi
blocks.content: Natural numbers are finite sets. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 21-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: nndomo
blocks.content: Cardinal ordering agrees with natural number ordering. Example 3 of [Enderton] p. 146. (Contributed by NM, 17-Jun-1998.)
blocks.origin:
thm nndomo(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)), wb(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wss(c0, c1)))
} = {
  impbid(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wss(c0, c1))
  sylibrd(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wss(c0, c1), wn(wpss(c1, c0)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com), wi(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wpss(c1, c0))))
  nsyli(wcel(c0, com), wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wpss(c1, c0), wbr(c1, csdm, c0))
  ex(wcel(c0, com), wpss(c1, c0), wbr(c1, csdm, c0))
  php2(c0, c1)
  domnsym(c0, c1)
  syl2an(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com), wb(wss(c0, c1), wn(wpss(c1, c0))), word(c0), word(c1))
  nnord(c0)
  nnord(c1)
  bitrd(wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wss(c0, c1), wn(wpss(c1, c0)), wn(wcel(c1, c0)))
  ordtri1(c0, c1)
  notbid(wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wcel(c1, c0), wpss(c1, c0))
  ancoms(word(c0), word(c1), wb(wcel(c1, c0), wpss(c1, c0)))
  ordelpss(c1, c0)
  adantl(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c0, c1), wbr(c0, cdom, c1)))
  ssdomg(c1, com, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm nndomo(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà _om ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om)‚Üí(c0[‚âº]c1 ‚Üî c0 ‚äÜ c1))
} = {
  impbid((c0 ‚àà _om ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om), c0[‚âº]c1, c0 ‚äÜ c1)
  sylibrd((c0 ‚àà _om ‚àß c1 ‚àà _om), c0[‚âº]c1, c0 ‚äÜ c1, ¬¨ c1 ‚ää c0)
  adantr(c0 ‚àà _om, c1 ‚àà _om, (c0[‚âº]c1 ‚Üí ¬¨ c1 ‚ää c0))
  nsyli(c0 ‚àà _om, c0[‚âº]c1, c1 ‚ää c0, c1[‚â∫]c0)
  ex(c0 ‚àà _om, c1 ‚ää c0, c1[‚â∫]c0)
  php2(c0, c1)
  domnsym(c0, c1)
  syl2an(c0 ‚àà _om, c1 ‚àà _om, (c0 ‚äÜ c1 ‚Üî ¬¨ c1 ‚ää c0), Ord(c0), Ord(c1))
  nnord(c0)
  nnord(c1)
  bitrd((Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1)), c0 ‚äÜ c1, ¬¨ c1 ‚ää c0, ¬¨ c1 ‚àà c0)
  ordtri1(c0, c1)
  notbid((Ord(c0)‚àß Ord(c1)), c1 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚ää c0)
  ancoms(Ord(c0), Ord(c1), (c1 ‚àà c0 ‚Üî c1 ‚ää c0))
  ordelpss(c1, c0)
  adantl(c0 ‚àà _om, c1 ‚àà _om, (c0 ‚äÜ c1 ‚Üí c0[‚âº]c1))

}

blocks.name: nnsdomo
blocks.content: Cardinal ordering agrees with natural number ordering. (Contributed by NM, 17-Jun-1998.)

blocks.name: sucdom2
blocks.content: Strict dominance of a set over another set implies dominance over its successor. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2013.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm sucdom2(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wbr(csuc(c0), cdom, c1))
} = {
  exlimddv(hs0, wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wbr(csuc(c0), cdom, c1), wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1))
  syl(wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wex(hs0, wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1))
  sdomdom(c0, c1)
  brdomi(hs0, c0, c1)
  3brtr4d(csuc(c0), cdom, c1, cun(c0, csn(c0)), cun(crn(cv(hs0)), cdif(c1, crn(cv(hs0)))), wa(wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)))
  syl21anc(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)), wbr(cun(c0, csn(c0)), cdom, cun(crn(cv(hs0)), cdif(c1, crn(cv(hs0))))), wbr(c0, cdom, crn(cv(hs0))), wbr(csn(c0), cdom, cdif(c1, crn(cv(hs0)))), wceq(cin(crn(cv(hs0)), cdif(c1, crn(cv(hs0)))), emptycls))
  syl3anc(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)), wbr(c0, cdom, crn(cv(hs0))), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(crn(cv(hs0)), universe), wf1(cv(hs0), c0, crn(cv(hs0))))
  a1i(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)), wcel(crn(cv(hs0)), universe))
  rnex(cv(hs0))
  syl(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)), wf1(cv(hs0), c0, crn(cv(hs0))), wf1o(cv(hs0), c0, crn(cv(hs0))))
  adantl(wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1), wf1o(cv(hs0), c0, crn(cv(hs0))))
  f1f1orn(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  f1of1(cv(hs0), c0, crn(cv(hs0)))

blocks.name: sucdom
blocks.content: Strict dominance of a set over a natural number is the same as dominance over its successor. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2013.)

blocks.name: 0sdom1dom
blocks.content: Strict dominance over zero is the same as dominance over one. (Contributed by NM, 28-Sep-2004.)

blocks.name: 1sdom2
blocks.content: Ordinal 1 is strictly dominated by ordinal 2. (Contributed by NM, 4-Apr-2007.)

blocks.name: sdom1
blocks.content: A set has less than one member iff it is empty. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 28-Oct-2014.)

blocks.name: 1sdom
blocks.content: A set that strictly dominates ordinal 1 has at least 2 different members. (Closely related to ~ 2dom .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2013.)

  breq2(cv(hs0), c0, c1o, csdm)

blocks.name: unxpdom
blocks.content: Cartesian product dominates union for sets with cardinality greater than 1. Proposition 10.36 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 93. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jan-2013.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: pssinf
blocks.content: A set equinumerous to a proper subset of itself is infinite. Corollary 6D(a) of [Enderton] p. 136. (Contributed by NM, 2-Jun-1998.)

blocks.name: fisseneq
blocks.content: A finite set is equal to its subset if they are equinumerous. (Contributed by FL, 11-Aug-2008.)

blocks.name: ominf
blocks.content: The set of natural numbers is infinite. Corollary 6D(b) of [Enderton] p. 136. (Contributed by NM, 2-Jun-1998.)

blocks.name: isinf
blocks.content: Any set that is not finite is literally infinite, in the sense that it contains subsets of arbitrarily large finite cardinality. (It cannot be proven that the set has _countably infinite_ subsets unless AC is invoked.) The proof does not require the Axiom of Infinity. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jan-2013.)

  ex(wcel(cv(hs3), crab(hs2, cpw(c0), wbr(cv(hs2), cen, cv(hs0)))), wcel(cv(hs3), crab(hs2, cpw(c0), wbr(cv(hs2), cen, cv(hs1)))), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cv(hs1)))

blocks.name: fineqv
blocks.content: If the Axiom of Infinity is denied, then all sets are finite (which implies the Axiom of Choice). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jan-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fineqv() {
  |- wb(wn(wcel(com, universe)), wceq(cfn, universe))
} = {
  impbii(wn(wcel(com, universe)), wceq(cfn, universe))
  eqssd(cfn, universe, wn(wcel(com, universe)))
  a1i(wn(wcel(com, universe)), wss(cfn, universe))
  ssv(cfn)
  ssrdv(hs0, universe, cfn, wn(wcel(com, universe)))
  a1d(wn(wcel(com, universe)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  con1i(wcel(com, universe), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  syl(wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfn)), wcel(com, universe), wbr(com, cdom, cpw(cpw(cv(hs0)))))
  mpan(wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cfn)), wbr(com, cdom, cpw(cpw(cv(hs0)))), wcel(cv(hs0), universe))
  vex(hs0)
  fineqvlem(cv(hs0), universe)
  brrelex1i(com, cdom, cpw(cpw(cv(hs0))))
  reldom()
  mtbii(wceq(cfn, universe), wcel(com, universe), wcel(com, cfn))
  ominf()
  eleq2(cfn, universe, com)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(cfn)
  diff.hs0.w(wn(wcel(com, universe)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fineqv() {
  ‚ä¢ (¬¨ _om ‚àà ùïå ‚Üî Fin = ùïå)
} = {
  impbii(¬¨ _om ‚àà ùïå, Fin = ùïå)
  eqssd(cfn, universe, ¬¨ _om ‚àà ùïå)
  a1i(¬¨ _om ‚àà ùïå, Fin ‚äÜ ùïå)
  ssv(cfn)
  ssrdv(hs0, universe, cfn, ¬¨ _om ‚àà ùïå)
  a1d(¬¨ _om ‚àà ùïå, hs0 ‚àà ùïå, hs0 ‚àà Fin)
  con1i(_om ‚àà ùïå, hs0 ‚àà Fin)
  syl(¬¨ hs0 ‚àà Fin, _om ‚àà ùïå, _om[‚âº]P(P(hs0)))
  mpan(¬¨ hs0 ‚àà Fin, _om[‚âº]P(P(hs0)), hs0 ‚àà ùïå)
  vex(hs0)

  reldom()
  mtbii(Fin = ùïå, _om ‚àà ùïå, _om ‚àà Fin)

  diff.hs0.w(¬¨ _om ‚àà ùïå)
}

blocks.name: enfi
blocks.content: Equinumerous sets have the same finiteness. (Contributed by NM, 22-Aug-2008.)

blocks.name: enfii
blocks.content: A set equinumerous to a finite set is finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: pssnn
blocks.content: A proper subset of a natural number is equinumerous to some smaller number. Lemma 6F of [Enderton] p. 137. (Contributed by NM, 22-Jun-1998.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 16-Nov-2014.)

blocks.name: domfi
blocks.content: A set dominated by a finite set is finite. (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.)

thm domfi(class c0, class c1) {

  ex(wcel(c0, cfn), wa(wbr(c1, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), c0)), wcel(c1, cfn))
  sylancom(wcel(c0, cfn), wa(wbr(c1, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), c0)), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  adantrl(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c1, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  ssfi(c0, cv(hs0))

  sylancom(c0 ‚àà Fin, (c1[‚âÖ]hs0 ‚àß hs0 ‚äÜ c0), c1 ‚àà Fin, hs0 ‚àà Fin)
  adantrl(c0 ‚àà Fin, c1[‚âÖ]hs0, hs0 ‚äÜ c0, hs0 ‚àà Fin)
  ssfi(c0, hs0)
  adantrr(hs0 ‚àà Fin, c1[‚âÖ]hs0, hs0 ‚äÜ c0, c1 ‚àà Fin)
  enfii(hs0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ‚àà Fin)
  diff.hs0.w(c1 ‚àà Fin)
}

blocks.name: xpfir
blocks.content: The components of a nonempty finite Cartesian product are finite. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 11-Apr-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm xpfir(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cfn)))
} = {
  jca(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cfn))
  syldan(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls), wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, cdom, cxp(c0, c1)))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wbr(c0, cdom, cxp(c0, c1)), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe), wne(c1, emptycls))
  simprd(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wne(c1, emptycls), wne(c0, emptycls))
  xpdom3(c0, universe, c1, universe)
  domfi(cxp(c0, c1), c0)
  syldan(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls), wcel(c1, cfn), wbr(c1, cdom, cxp(c0, c1)))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wbr(c1, cdom, cxp(c0, c1)), wbr(c1, cdom, cxp(c1, c0)), wbr(cxp(c1, c0), cen, cxp(c0, c1)))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wbr(c1, cdom, cxp(c1, c0)), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c0, universe), wne(c0, emptycls))
  simpld(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wne(c0, emptycls), wne(c1, emptycls))
  sylibr(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wne(c1, emptycls)), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls))
  simpr(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls))
  xpnz(c0, c1)
  xpdom3(c1, universe, c0, universe)
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wbr(cxp(c1, c0), cen, cxp(c0, c1)), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  simprd(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  simpld(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cfn), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe))
  xpexr2(c0, c1, cfn)
  xpcomeng(c1, universe, c0, universe)
  domentr(c1, cxp(c1, c0), cxp(c0, c1))
  domfi(cxp(c0, c1), c1)
}

blocks.name: ssfid
blocks.content: A subset of a finite set is finite, deduction version of ~ ssfi . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 21-Nov-2020.)

blocks.name: infi
blocks.content: The intersection of two sets is finite if one of them is. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 14-Feb-2017.)

blocks.name: rabfi
blocks.content: A restricted class built from a finite set is finite. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 14-Feb-2017.)

blocks.name: finresfin
blocks.content: The restriction of a finite set is finite. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Jan-2018.)

blocks.name: f1finf1o
blocks.content: Any injection from one finite set to another of equal size must be a bijection. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 5-Jun-2010.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Feb-2014.)

  necon4ad(crn(c2), c1, wa(wa(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wf1(c2, c0, c1)), wbr(c0, cen, c1))
  sylbird(wa(wa(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wf1(c2, c0, c1)), wne(crn(c2), c1), wn(wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wpss(crn(c2), c1))
  syl(wa(wa(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wf1(c2, c0, c1)), wb(wpss(crn(c2), c1), wne(crn(c2), c1)), wss(crn(c2), c1))

  syl6an(wa(wa(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wf1(c2, c0, c1)), wpss(crn(c2), c1), wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wbr(c0, cen, crn(c2)), wbr(crn(c2), csdm, c1))
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wf1(c2, c0, c1)), wbr(c0, cen, crn(c2)), wcel(c2, co(c1, cmap, c0)), wf1o(c2, c0, crn(c2)))

  adantl(wa(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wf1(c2, c0, c1), wf(c2, c0, c1))
  f1f(c2, c0, c1)
  elmapd(c2, c1, c0, cfn, universe, wa(wa(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wf1(c2, c0, c1)))

  simplr(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn), wf1(c2, c0, c1))

  syl2anc(((c0[‚âÖ]c1 ‚àß c1 ‚àà Fin)‚àß(c2 : c0 ‚Ü£ c1)), c0[‚âÖ]ran(c2), c2 ‚àà(c1[‚Ü¶]c0), (c2 : c0 ‚Üî ran(c2)))
  mpbird(((c0[‚âÖ]c1 ‚àß c1 ‚àà Fin)‚àß(c2 : c0 ‚Ü£ c1)), c2 ‚àà(c1[‚Ü¶]c0), (c2 : c0 ‚Üí c1))

blocks.name: 0fin
blocks.content: The empty set is finite. (Contributed by FL, 14-Jul-2008.)

blocks.name: nfielex
blocks.content: If a class is not finite, then it contains at least one element. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 12-Jan-2018.)

blocks.name: en1eqsn
blocks.content: A set with one element is a singleton. (Contributed by FL, 18-Aug-2008.)
blocks.origin:
thm en1eqsn(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c1o)), wceq(c1, csn(c0)))
} = {
  eqcomd(c1, csn(c0), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c1o)))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c1o)), wceq(csn(c0), c1), wcel(c1, cfn), wss(csn(c0), c1), wbr(csn(c0), cen, c1))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c1o), wcel(c1, cfn))
  mpan(wbr(c1, cen, c1o), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c1o, cfn))
  mp2an(wcel(c1o, cfn), wcel(c1o, com), wss(c1o, c1o))
  1onn()
  ssid(c1o)
  ssnnfi(c1o, c1o)
  enfii(c1o, c1)
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c1o), wss(csn(c0), c1))
  snssi(c0, c1)
  syl2an(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c1o), wbr(csn(c0), cen, c1), wbr(csn(c0), cen, c1o), wbr(c1o, cen, c1))
  ensn1g(c0, c1)
  ensym(c1, c1o)
  entr(csn(c0), c1o, c1)
  fisseneq(c1, csn(c0))
}

blocks.name: en1eqsnbi
blocks.content: A set containing an element has exactly one element iff it is a singleton. Formerly part of proof for ~ rngen1zr . (Contributed by FL, 13-Feb-2010.) (Revised by AV, 25-Jan-2020.)

blocks.name: diffi
blocks.content: If ` A ` is finite, ` ( A \ B ) ` is finite. (Contributed by FL, 3-Aug-2009.)

blocks.name: dif1en
blocks.content: If a set ` A ` is equinumerous to the successor of a natural number ` M ` , then ` A ` with an element removed is equinumerous to ` M ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 16-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm dif1en(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

blocks.content: Lemma for uses of ~ enp1i . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jan-2016.)

thm enp1ilem(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wi(wceq(cdif(c0, csn(cv(s0))), c1), wceq(c0, c2)))
  -| wceq(c2, cun(csn(cv(s0)), c1))
} = {
  syl5ib(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cdif(c0, csn(cv(s0))), c1), wceq(c0, c2), wceq(cun(c0, csn(cv(s0))), c2))
  3eqtr3g(cun(c0, csn(cv(s0))), c2, cun(cdif(c0, csn(cv(s0))), csn(cv(s0))), cun(c1, csn(cv(s0))), wceq(cdif(c0, csn(cv(s0))), c1))
  uneq1(cdif(c0, csn(cv(s0))), c1, csn(cv(s0)))
  undif1(c0, csn(cv(s0)))
  eqtr4i(cun(c1, csn(cv(s0))), c2, cun(csn(cv(s0)), c1))
  uncom(c1, csn(cv(s0)))
  eqeq1d(cun(c0, csn(cv(s0))), c2, c0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  sylib(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cun(c0, csn(cv(s0))), c0), wss(csn(cv(s0)), c0))
  snssi(cv(s0), c0)
  ssequn2(csn(cv(s0)), c0)
}

thm enp1ilem(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Üí((c0 \ { s0 })= c1 ‚Üí c0 = c2))
  ‚ä£ c2 =({ s0 } ‚ãÉ c1)
} = {

  3eqtr3g((c0 ‚ãÉ { s0 }), c2, ((c0 \ { s0 })‚ãÉ { s0 }), (c1 ‚ãÉ { s0 }), (c0 \ { s0 })= c1)
  uneq1((c0 \ { s0 }), c1, { s0 })
  undif1(c0, { s0 })
  eqtr4i((c1 ‚ãÉ { s0 }), c2, ({ s0 } ‚ãÉ c1))
  uncom(c1, { s0 })

thm enp1i(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wex(s0, w0))
  -| wcel(c2, com)
  -| wceq(c1, csuc(c2))
  -| wi(wbr(cdif(c0, csn(cv(s0))), cen, c2), w1)
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpd(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wex(s0, w0), wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  sylib(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wn(wceq(c0, emptycls)))
  con2i(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  mpi(wceq(c0, emptycls), wn(wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wne(csuc(c2), emptycls))
  nsuceq0(c2)
  necon3ad(csuc(c2), emptycls, wceq(c0, emptycls), wbr(c0, cen, c1))
  syl6bi(wceq(c0, emptycls), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wceq(csuc(c2), emptycls), wbr(emptycls, cen, c1))
  breq1(c0, emptycls, cen, c1)
  syl5eqr(csuc(c2), emptycls, c1, wbr(emptycls, cen, c1))
  sylib(wbr(emptycls, cen, c1), wceq(c1, emptycls), wbr(c1, cen, emptycls))
  ensym(emptycls, c1)
  en0(c1)
  neq0(s0, c0)
  eximdv(s0, wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)
  sylcom(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0, w1)
  sylbi(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w1), wbr(c0, cen, csuc(c2)))
  breq2i(c0, cen, c1, csuc(c2))
  ex(wbr(c0, cen, csuc(c2)), wcel(cv(s0), c0), w1)
  syl(wa(wbr(c0, cen, csuc(c2)), wcel(cv(s0), c0)), w1, wbr(cdif(c0, csn(cv(s0))), cen, c2))
  mp3an1(wbr(c0, cen, csuc(c2)), wcel(cv(s0), c0), wbr(cdif(c0, csn(cv(s0))), cen, c2), wcel(c2, com))
  dif1en(c2, c0, cv(s0))
  diff.wbr.s(s0, c0, cen, c1)
  diff.cen.s(s0)
}

thm enp1i(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0[‚âÖ]c1 ‚Üí ‚àÉ(s0, w0))
  ‚ä£ c2 ‚àà _om
  ‚ä£ c1 = suc(c2)
  ‚ä£ ((c0 \ { s0 })[‚âÖ]c2 ‚Üí w1)
  ‚ä£ (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üí w0))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpd(c0[‚âÖ]c1, ‚àÉ(s0, w0), ‚àÉ(s0, s0 ‚àà c0))
  sylib(c0[‚âÖ]c1, ‚àÉ(s0, s0 ‚àà c0), ¬¨ c0 = ‚àÖ)
  con2i(c0[‚âÖ]c1, c0 = ‚àÖ)
  mpi(c0 = ‚àÖ, ¬¨ c0[‚âÖ]c1, suc(c2)‚â† ‚àÖ)
  nsuceq0(c2)
  necon3ad(suc(c2), emptycls, c0 = ‚àÖ, c0[‚âÖ]c1)
  syl6bi(c0 = ‚àÖ, c0[‚âÖ]c1, suc(c2)= ‚àÖ, ‚àÖ[‚âÖ]c1)
  breq1(c0, emptycls, cen, c1)
  syl5eqr(suc(c2), emptycls, c1, ‚àÖ[‚âÖ]c1)
  sylib(‚àÖ[‚âÖ]c1, c1 = ‚àÖ, c1[‚âÖ]‚àÖ)
  ensym(emptycls, c1)
  en0(c1)
  neq0(s0, c0)
  eximdv(s0, c0[‚âÖ]c1, s0 ‚àà c0, w0)
  sylcom(c0[‚âÖ]c1, s0 ‚àà c0, w0, w1)
  sylbi(c0[‚âÖ]c1, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Üí w1), c0[‚âÖ]suc(c2))
  breq2i(c0, cen, c1, suc(c2))
  ex(c0[‚âÖ]suc(c2), s0 ‚àà c0, w1)
  syl((c0[‚âÖ]suc(c2)‚àß s0 ‚àà c0), w1, (c0 \ { s0 })[‚âÖ]c2)
  mp3an1(c0[‚âÖ]suc(c2), s0 ‚àà c0, (c0 \ { s0 })[‚âÖ]c2, c2 ‚àà _om)
  dif1en(c2, c0, s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, c0, cen, c1)
  diff.cen.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: findcard
blocks.content: Schema for induction on the cardinality of a finite set. The inductive hypothesis is that the result is true on the given set with any one element removed. The result is then proven to be true for all finite sets. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)
blocks.origin:
thm findcard(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfn), w0)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wb(w1, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cdif(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))), wb(w1, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w1, w4))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))
  -| w2
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wi(wral(s2, cv(s1), w3), w4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
  -| diffsw(s2, w1)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfn), w0), diffsc(s1, c0))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfn), w0), diffsc(s2, c0))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfn), w0), diffsw(s0, w2))
  vtoclga(s0, c0, cfn, w0, w1)
  sylbi(wcel(cv(s0), cfn), w1, wrex(hs0, com, wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0))))
  isfi(hs0, cv(s0))
  rexlimiv(hs0, com, wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1)
  19.21bi(s0, wcel(cv(hs0), com), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1))
  finds1(hs0, hs1, wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1)), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, emptycls), w1)), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), w1)))
  albidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, emptycls), w1))
  imbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1, wbr(cv(s0), cen, emptycls))
  breq2(cv(hs0), emptycls, cv(s0), cen)
  albidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1))
  imbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1, wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)))
  breq2(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), cv(s0), cen)
  albidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1))), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), w1))
  imbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1))), wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1, wbr(cv(s0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))))
  breq2(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1)), cv(s0), cen)
  ax-gen(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, emptycls), w1))
  sylbi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, emptycls), w1, wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))
  en0(cv(s0))
  mpbiri(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), w1, w2)
  syl6ibr(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), w1)), wal(s1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), w4)))
  alrimdv(s1, wcel(cv(hs1), com), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wi(wbr(cv(s1), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), w4))
  3exp(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wbr(cv(s1), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), w4)
  sylc(w3a(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wbr(cv(s1), cen, csuc(cv(hs1)))), w4, wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wral(s2, cv(s1), w3))
  3adant2(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wbr(cv(s1), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(s1), cfn))
  sylibr(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wbr(cv(s1), cen, csuc(cv(hs1)))), wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wrex(hs0, com, wbr(cv(s1), cen, cv(hs0))))
  sylan(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wbr(cv(s1), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), wrex(hs0, com, wbr(cv(s1), cen, cv(hs0))), wcel(csuc(cv(hs1)), com))
  peano2(cv(hs1))
  rspcev(hs0, csuc(cv(hs1)), com, wbr(cv(s1), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), wbr(cv(s1), cen, cv(hs0)))
  breq2(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1)), cv(s1), cen)

  an32s(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wbr(cv(s1), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), wral(s2, cv(s1), w3))

blocks.name: findcard2
blocks.content: Schema for induction on the cardinality of a finite set. The inductive step shows that the result is true if one more element is added to the set. The result is then proven to be true for all finite sets. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 8-Jul-2010.)
blocks.origin:
thm findcard2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfn), w0)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wb(w1, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w1, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))), wb(w1, w4))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))
  -| w2
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wi(w3, w4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
  -| diffsw(s2, w1)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfn), w0), diffsc(s1, c0))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfn), w0), diffsc(s2, c0))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfn), w0), diffsw(s0, w2))
  vtoclga(s0, c0, cfn, w0, w1)
  sylbi(wcel(cv(s0), cfn), w1, wrex(hs0, com, wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0))))
  isfi(hs0, cv(s0))
  rexlimiv(hs0, com, wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1)
  19.21bi(s0, wcel(cv(hs0), com), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1))
  finds1(hs0, hs1, wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1)), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, emptycls), w1)), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), w1)))
  albidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, emptycls), w1))
  imbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1, wbr(cv(s0), cen, emptycls))
  breq2(cv(hs0), emptycls, cv(s0), cen)
  albidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1))
  imbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1, wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)))
  breq2(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), cv(s0), cen)
  albidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1))), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), w1))
  imbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1))), wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), w1, wbr(cv(s0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))))
  breq2(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1)), cv(s0), cen)
  ax-gen(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, emptycls), w1))
  sylbi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, emptycls), w1, wceq(cv(s0), emptycls))
  en0(cv(s0))
  mpbiri(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), w1, w2)
  syl6ibr(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), w1)), wal(hs0, wi(wbr(cv(hs0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), w1))))
  alrimdv(hs0, wcel(cv(hs1), com), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wi(wbr(cv(hs0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), w1)))
  com23(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), w1))
  mpdd(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), wi(wal(s0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs1)), w1)), wsbc(s0, cv(hs0), w1)), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls))
  ex(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls))
  mpi(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1)))), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wne(csuc(cv(hs1)), emptycls))
  nsuceq0(cv(hs1))
  necon3d(csuc(cv(hs1)), emptycls, cv(hs0), emptycls, wa(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1)))))
  com12(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(csuc(cv(hs1)), emptycls))
  syl6bi(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1)))), wceq(csuc(cv(hs1)), emptycls), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wbr(emptycls, cen, csuc(cv(hs1)))))
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wcel(cv(hs1), com), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, csuc(cv(hs1))), wbr(emptycls, cen, csuc(cv(hs1))))
  breq1(cv(hs0), emptycls, cen, csuc(cv(hs1)))

blocks.name: findcard2s
blocks.content: Variation of ~ findcard2 requiring that the element added in the induction step not be a member of the original set. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 30-Nov-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm findcard2s(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfn), w0)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wb(w1, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w1, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))), wb(w1, w4))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))
  -| w2
  -| wi(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wi(w3, w4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
  -| diffsw(s2, w1)
} = {
  findcard2(s0, s1, s2, c0, w0, w1, w2, w3, w4)
  pm2.61d2(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wi(w3, w4), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))
  ex(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1))), wi(w3, w4))
  biimpd(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w3, w4)
  syl(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wb(w3, w4), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))))))
  sylib(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))))), wceq(cv(s1), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))))
  syl5reqr(cv(s1), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), cun(csn(cv(s2)), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))
  uncom(csn(cv(s2)), cv(s1))
  sylib(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wceq(cun(csn(cv(s2)), cv(s1)), cv(s1)), wss(csn(cv(s2)), cv(s1)))
  snssi(cv(s2), cv(s1))
  ssequn1(csn(cv(s2)), cv(s1))
  eqvinc(s0, cv(s1), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))))
  vex(s1)
  exlimiv(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))))), wb(w3, w4))
  sylan9bb(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))), w3, w4, w1)
  bicomd(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w3, w1)
  diff.cun.s(s0, cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.csn.s(s0, cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.wb.s(s0, w3, w4)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm findcard2s(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚Üí w0)
  ‚ä£ (s0 = ‚àÖ ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üî w2))
  ‚ä£ (s0 = s1 ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üî w3))
  ‚ä£ (s0 =(s1 ‚ãÉ { s2 })‚Üí(w1 ‚Üî w4))
  ‚ä£ (s0 = c0 ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üî w0))
  ‚ä£ w2
  ‚ä£ ((s1 ‚àà Fin ‚àß ¬¨ s2 ‚àà s1)‚Üí(w3 ‚Üí w4))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, w1)
} = {
  findcard2(s0, s1, s2, c0, w0, w1, w2, w3, w4)
  pm2.61d2(s1 ‚àà Fin, (w3 ‚Üí w4), s2 ‚àà s1)
  ex(s1 ‚àà Fin, ¬¨ s2 ‚àà s1, (w3 ‚Üí w4))
  biimpd(s2 ‚àà s1, w3, w4)
  syl(s2 ‚àà s1, (w3 ‚Üî w4), ‚àÉ(s0,(s0 = s1 ‚àß s0 =(s1 ‚ãÉ { s2 }))))
  sylib(s2 ‚àà s1, ‚àÉ(s0,(s0 = s1 ‚àß s0 =(s1 ‚ãÉ { s2 }))), s1 =(s1 ‚ãÉ { s2 }))
  syl5reqr(s1, (s1 ‚ãÉ { s2 }), ({ s2 } ‚ãÉ s1), s2 ‚àà s1)
  uncom({ s2 }, s1)
  sylib(s2 ‚àà s1, ({ s2 } ‚ãÉ s1)= s1, { s2 } ‚äÜ s1)
  snssi(s2, s1)
  ssequn1({ s2 }, s1)
  eqvinc(s0, s1, (s1 ‚ãÉ { s2 }))
  vex(s1)
  exlimiv(s0, (s0 = s1 ‚àß s0 =(s1 ‚ãÉ { s2 })), (w3 ‚Üî w4))
  sylan9bb(s0 = s1, s0 =(s1 ‚ãÉ { s2 }), w3, w4, w1)
  bicomd(s0 = s1, w3, w1)
  diff.cun.s(s0, s1, { s2 })
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.csn.s(s0, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.wb.s(s0, w3, w4)
}

blocks.name: findcard2d
blocks.content: Deduction version of ~ findcard2 . (Contributed by SO, 16-Jul-2018.)

thm findcard2d(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4, wff w5) {
  |- wi(w0, w1)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wb(w2, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w2, w4))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))), wb(w2, w5))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w2, w1))
  -| wi(w0, w3)
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wss(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s2), cdif(c0, cv(s1))))), wi(w4, w5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfn))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w5)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w2)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w2)
} = {
  mpan2(w0, w1, wss(c0, c0))
  ssid(c0)
  mpcom(wa(w0, wss(c0, c0)), w1, wcel(c0, cfn))
  adantr(w0, wss(c0, c0), wcel(c0, cfn))
  findcard2s(s0, s1, s2, c0, wi(wa(w0, wss(c0, c0)), w1), wi(wa(w0, wss(cv(s0), c0)), w2), wi(wa(w0, wss(emptycls, c0)), w3), wi(wa(w0, wss(cv(s1), c0)), w4), wi(wa(w0, wss(cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), c0)), w5))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wa(w0, wss(cv(s0), c0)), w2, wa(w0, wss(emptycls, c0)), w3)
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), w0, wss(cv(s0), c0), wss(emptycls, c0))
  sseq1(cv(s0), emptycls, c0)
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wa(w0, wss(cv(s0), c0)), w2, wa(w0, wss(cv(s1), c0)), w4)
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0, wss(cv(s0), c0), wss(cv(s1), c0))
  sseq1(cv(s0), cv(s1), c0)
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))), wa(w0, wss(cv(s0), c0)), w2, wa(w0, wss(cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), c0)), w5)
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))), w0, wss(cv(s0), c0), wss(cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), c0))
  sseq1(cv(s0), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), c0)
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wa(w0, wss(cv(s0), c0)), w2, wa(w0, wss(c0, c0)), w1)
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w0, wss(cv(s0), c0), wss(c0, c0))
  sseq1(cv(s0), c0, c0)
  adantr(w0, wss(emptycls, c0), w3)
  com23(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wi(wa(w0, wss(cv(s1), c0)), w4), wa(w0, wss(cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), c0)), w5)
  ex(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wa(w0, wss(cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), c0)), wi(wi(wa(w0, wss(cv(s1), c0)), w4), w5))
  embantd(wa(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wa(w0, wss(cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), c0))), wa(w0, wss(cv(s1), c0)), w4, w5)
  jca(wa(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wa(w0, wss(cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), c0))), w0, wss(cv(s1), c0))
  syl12anc(wa(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wa(w0, wss(cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), c0))), wi(w4, w5), w0, wss(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s2), cdif(c0, cv(s1))))
  simprl(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), w0, wss(cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), c0))
  unssad(cv(s1), c0, csn(cv(s2)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cfn), wn(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wa(w0, wss(cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2))), c0))))

blocks.name: findcard3
blocks.content: Schema for strong induction on the cardinality of a finite set. The inductive hypothesis is that the result is true on any proper subset. The result is then proven to be true for all finite sets. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Dec-2013.)

blocks.name: frfi
blocks.content: A partial order is well-founded on a finite set. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 18-Jun-2010.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-Jan-2014.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: wofi
blocks.content: A total order on a finite set is a well-order. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 18-Jun-2010.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-Jan-2014.)

blocks.name: ordunifi
blocks.content: The maximum of a finite collection of ordinals is in the set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Jan-2014.)

thm ordunifi(class c0) {

  syl3an1(wss(c0, con0), wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(hs0, c0, wral(hs1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), cep, cv(hs1))))), wor(cep, c0))
  mpi(wss(c0, con0), wor(cep, c0), wor(cep, con0))
  ax-mp(wor(cep, con0), wwe(cep, con0))
  epweon()
  weso(cep, con0)
  soss(c0, con0, cep)
  fimax2g(hs0, hs1, cep, c0)
  3ad2ant1(wss(c0, con0), wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls), wb(wrex(hs0, c0, wral(hs1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), cep, cv(hs1))))), wrex(hs0, c0, wss(cuni(c0), cv(hs0)))))
  rexbidva(hs0, c0, wss(c0, con0), wral(hs1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), cep, cv(hs1)))), wss(cuni(c0), cv(hs0)))
  syl6bbr(wa(wss(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), c0)), wral(hs1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), cep, cv(hs1)))), wss(cuni(c0), cv(hs0)), wral(hs1, c0, wss(cv(hs1), cv(hs0))))
  ralbidva(hs1, c0, wa(wss(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), c0)), wn(wbr(cv(hs0), cep, cv(hs1))), wss(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))

  ssel2(c0, con0, cv(hs1))
  adantr(wa(wss(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), c0)), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), con0))
  ssel2(c0, con0, cv(hs0))
  syl6rbbr(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), con0), wcel(cv(hs0), con0)), wn(wbr(cv(hs0), cep, cv(hs1))), wss(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  ontri1(cv(hs1), cv(hs0))
  notbii(wbr(cv(hs0), cep, cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  epel(hs1, cv(hs0))
  unissb(hs1, c0, cv(hs0))
  rexlimiv(hs0, c0, wss(cuni(c0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(c0), c0))
  mpand(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cuni(c0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cuni(c0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)))
  elssuni(cv(hs0), c0)
  syl5bir(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wss(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)), wss(cuni(c0), cv(hs0))), wcel(cuni(c0), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)))
  eqss(cv(hs0), cuni(c0))
  biimpcd(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)), wcel(cuni(c0), c0))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), cuni(c0), c0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(cep)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cep)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)

blocks.name: nnunifi
blocks.content: The union (supremum) of a finite set of finite ordinals is a finite ordinal. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm nnunifi(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wss(c0, com), wcel(c0, cfn)), wcel(cuni(c0), com))
} = {
  pm2.61dane(c0, emptycls, wa(wss(c0, com), wcel(c0, cfn)), wcel(cuni(c0), com))

  unieq(c0, emptycls)
  eqeltri(cuni(emptycls), com, emptycls)

  peano1()
  sseldd(cuni(c0), com, c0, wa(wa(wss(c0, com), wcel(c0, cfn)), wne(c0, emptycls)))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wss(c0, com), wcel(c0, cfn)), wne(c0, emptycls)), wcel(cuni(c0), c0), wss(c0, con0), wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls))
  syl6ss(c0, con0, com, wa(wa(wss(c0, com), wcel(c0, cfn)), wne(c0, emptycls)))

  simplr(wss(c0, com), wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls))

}

blocks.name: unblem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ unbnn . After removing the successor of an element from an unbounded set of natural numbers, the intersection of the result belongs to the original unbounded set. (Contributed by NM, 3-Dec-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm unblem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(c1, c0)), wcel(cint(cdif(c0, csuc(c1))), c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  eldifad(cint(cdif(c0, csuc(c1))), c0, csuc(c1), wa(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(c1, c0)))
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(c1, c0)), wcel(cint(cdif(c0, csuc(c1))), cdif(c0, csuc(c1))), wss(cdif(c0, csuc(c1)), con0), wne(cdif(c0, csuc(c1)), emptycls))
  ad2antrr(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(c1, c0), wss(cdif(c0, csuc(c1)), con0))
  ssdifssd(c0, csuc(c1), con0, wss(c0, com))
  mpan2(wss(c0, com), wss(c0, con0), wss(com, con0))
  omsson()
  sstr(c0, com, con0)
  impl(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(c1, c0), wne(cdif(c0, csuc(c1)), emptycls))
  sylan2d(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(c1, c0), wne(cdif(c0, csuc(c1)), emptycls), wcel(csuc(c1), com))
  syl6ib(wss(c0, com), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), com), wcel(c1, com))
  ssel(c0, com, c1)
  peano2b(c1)
  syl5(wss(c0, com), wa(wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(csuc(c1), com)), wne(cdif(c0, csuc(c1)), emptycls), wrex(s1, c0, wcel(csuc(c1), cv(s1))))
  rspccva(s0, com, csuc(c1), wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wrex(s1, c0, wcel(csuc(c1), cv(s1))))

blocks.name: unblem3
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ unbnn . The value of the function ` F ` is less than its value at a successor. (Contributed by NM, 3-Dec-2003.)

thm unblem3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wi(wcel(cv(s2), com), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), cfv(c1, csuc(cv(s2))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cres(crdg(cmpt(s3, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(s3))))), cint(c0)), com))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s3, c0)
} = {
  ex(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(s2), com), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), cfv(c1, csuc(cv(s2)))))
  eleqtrrd(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), cfv(c1, csuc(cv(s2))), cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cfv(c1, cv(s2))))), wa(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(s2), com)))
  syl(wa(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(s2), com)), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cfv(c1, cv(s2)))))), wa(wss(c0, con0), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), con0)))
  mpd(wa(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(s2), com)), wa(wss(c0, con0), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), con0)), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), c0))
  imp(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(s2), com), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), c0))
  ad2antrr(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(s2), com), wi(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), c0), wa(wss(c0, con0), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), con0))))
  syl(wss(c0, com), wi(wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), c0), wa(wss(c0, con0), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), con0))), wss(c0, con0))
  mpan2(wss(c0, com), wss(c0, con0), wss(com, con0))
  omsson()
  sstr(c0, com, con0)
  anc2li(wss(c0, con0), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), c0), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), con0))
  ssel(c0, con0, cfv(c1, cv(s2)))
  onmindif(c0, cfv(c1, cv(s2)))
  imp(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(s2), com), wceq(cfv(c1, csuc(cv(s2))), cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cfv(c1, cv(s2)))))))
  sylcom(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(s2), com), wceq(cfv(c1, csuc(cv(s2))), cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cfv(c1, cv(s2)))))), wcel(cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cfv(c1, cv(s2))))), c0))
  syld(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(s2), com), wcel(cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cfv(c1, cv(s2))))), c0), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), c0))
  unblem2(s0, s1, s2, s3, c0, c1)
  ex(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(s2)), c0), wcel(cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cfv(c1, cv(s2))))), c0))
  unblem1(s0, s1, c0, cfv(c1, cv(s2)))

  frsucmpt2(s3, hs0, cv(s2), cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cfv(c1, cv(s2))))), c0, c1, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(s3)))), cint(c0), cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0)))))
  inteqd(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))), cdif(c0, csuc(cv(s3))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s3)))
  difeq2d(c0, csuc(cv(hs0)), csuc(cv(s3)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s3)))
  suceq(cv(hs0), cv(s3))
  inteqd(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))), cdif(c0, csuc(cfv(c1, cv(s2)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(c1, cv(s2))))
  difeq2d(c0, csuc(cv(hs0)), csuc(cfv(c1, cv(s2))), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(c1, cv(s2))))
  suceq(cv(hs0), cfv(c1, cv(s2)))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1, cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c1, cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
  diff.cint.s(s3, cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))
  diff.cdif.s(s3, c0, csuc(cv(hs0)))
  diff.csuc.s(s3, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s3, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s3, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s3)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s2))
  diff.hs0.c(cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cfv(c1, cv(s2))))))
  diff.hs0.c(cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(s3)))))
  diff.hs0.c(cint(c0))
}

  syl(c0 ‚äÜ _om, ((c1 ` s2)‚àà c0 ‚Üí(c0 ‚äÜ On ‚àß(c1 ` s2)‚àà On)), c0 ‚äÜ On)

  sylcom((c0 ‚äÜ _om ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà _om, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c0, s0 ‚àà s1))), s2 ‚àà _om, (c1 ` suc(s2))= ‚ãÇ(c0 \ suc((c1 ` s2))), ‚ãÇ(c0 \ suc((c1 ` s2)))‚àà c0)
  syld((c0 ‚äÜ _om ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà _om, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c0, s0 ‚àà s1))), s2 ‚àà _om, ‚ãÇ(c0 \ suc((c1 ` s2)))‚àà c0, (c1 ` s2)‚àà c0)

blocks.name: unblem4
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ unbnn . The function ` F ` maps the set of natural numbers one-to-one to the set of unbounded natural numbers ` A ` . (Contributed by NM, 3-Dec-2003.)

thm unblem4(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {

  -| wceq(c1, cres(crdg(cmpt(s2, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(s2))))), cint(c0)), com))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
} = {
  syl21anc(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wf1(c1, com, c0), wss(c0, con0), wf(c1, com, c0), wral(hs0, com, wcel(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, csuc(cv(hs0))))))
  adantr(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wss(c0, con0))

blocks.name: unbnn
blocks.content: Any unbounded subset of natural numbers is equinumerous to the set of all natural numbers. Part of the proof of Theorem 42 of [Suppes] p. 151. See ~ unbnn3 for a stronger version without the first assumption. (Contributed by NM, 3-Dec-2003.)

blocks.name: isfinite2
blocks.content: Any set strictly dominated by the class of natural numbers is finite. Sufficiency part of Theorem 42 of [Suppes] p. 151. This theorem does not require the Axiom of Infinity. (Contributed by NM, 24-Apr-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm isfinite2(class c0) {
  |- wi(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wcel(c0, cfn))
} = {
  mpcom(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(com, universe))
  sylcom(wcel(com, universe), wbr(c0, csdm, com), wcel(c0, cfn), wex(hs0, wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))))
  syl5ib(wcel(com, universe), wbr(c0, csdm, com), wex(hs0, wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))), wbr(c0, cdom, com))
  sdomdom(c0, com)
  domeng(hs0, com, universe, c0)
  exlimdv(hs0, wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com)), wcel(c0, cfn))
  ex(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com)), wcel(c0, cfn))
  syl2anc(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)))
  mpd(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wn(wral(hs1, com, wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))))

blocks.name: nnsdomg
blocks.content: Omega strictly dominates a natural number. Example 3 of [Enderton] p. 146. In order to avoid the Axiom of infinity, we include it as a hypothesis. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jun-1998.)
blocks.origin:
thm nnsdomg(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, com)), wbr(c0, csdm, com))
} = {
  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, com)), wbr(c0, csdm, com), wbr(c0, cdom, com), wn(wbr(c0, cen, com)))
  impel(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, com), wbr(c0, cdom, com), wss(c0, com))
  ssdomg(com, universe, c0)
  mpan(wcel(c0, com), wss(c0, com), word(com))
  ordom()
  ordelss(com, c0)
  adantl(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, com), wn(wbr(c0, cen, com)))
  mtoi(wcel(c0, com), wbr(c0, cen, com), wcel(com, cfn))
  ominf()
  syl5(wcel(c0, com), wbr(c0, cen, com), wcel(com, cfn), wbr(com, cen, c0))
  ensym(c0, com)
  ex(wcel(c0, com), wbr(com, cen, c0), wcel(com, cfn))
  sylibr(wa(wcel(c0, com), wbr(com, cen, c0)), wcel(com, cfn), wrex(hs0, com, wbr(com, cen, cv(hs0))))
  rspcev(hs0, c0, com, wbr(com, cen, c0), wbr(com, cen, cv(hs0)))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c0, com, cen)
  isfi(hs0, com)
  brsdom(c0, com)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(com)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(com, cen, c0))
}

blocks.name: isfiniteg
blocks.content: A set is finite iff it is strictly dominated by the class of natural number. Theorem 42 of [Suppes] p. 151. In order to avoid the Axiom of infinity, we include it as a hypothesis. (Contributed by NM, 3-Nov-2002.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm isfiniteg(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(com, universe), wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com)))
} = {
  impbid1(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com))
  syl5bi(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com), wrex(hs0, com, wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0))))
  isfi(hs0, c0)
  rexlimdva(hs0, com, wcel(com, universe), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wbr(c0, csdm, com))
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wcel(com, universe), wcel(cv(hs0), com)), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wbr(c0, csdm, com), wbr(cv(hs0), csdm, com))
  nnsdomg(cv(hs0))
  sdomen1(c0, cv(hs0), com)
  isfinite2(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(com, universe))
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c0, csdm, com))
}

blocks.name: infsdomnn
blocks.content: An infinite set strictly dominates a natural number. (Contributed by NM, 22-Nov-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: infn0
blocks.content: An infinite set is not empty. (Contributed by NM, 23-Oct-2004.)

blocks.name: fin2inf
blocks.content: This (useless) theorem, which was proved without the Axiom of Infinity, demonstrates an artifact of our definition of binary relation, which is meaningful only when its arguments exist. In particular, the antecedent cannot be satisfied unless ` _om ` exists. (Contributed by NM, 13-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: unfilem1
blocks.content: Lemma for proving that the union of two finite sets is finite. (Contributed by NM, 10-Nov-2002.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm unfilem1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(crn(c0), cdif(co(c1, coa, c2), c1))
  -| wcel(c1, com)
  -| wcel(c2, com)
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c2, co(c1, coa, cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, crn(c0), cdif(co(c1, coa, c2), c1))
  3bitr4i(wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cdif(co(c1, coa, c2), c1)), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  impbii(wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  rexlimiva(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  sylan(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))), wa(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), c1))))
  jca(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), c1)))
  ibi(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), co(c1, coa, c2)))

  mpanr12(wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wbr(cdif(c1, c0), cen, cdif(co(cv(hs0), coa, cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)))), wbr(cun(c0, cdif(c1, c0)), cen, cun(cv(hs0), cdif(co(cv(hs0), coa, cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cin(c0, cdif(c1, c0)), emptycls), wceq(cin(cv(hs0), cdif(co(cv(hs0), coa, cv(hs1)), cv(hs0))), emptycls))

blocks.name: unfir
blocks.content: If a union is finite, the operands are finite. Converse of ~ unfi . (Contributed by FL, 3-Aug-2009.)

blocks.name: unfi2
blocks.content: The union of two finite sets is finite. Part of Corollary 6K of [Enderton] p. 144. This version of ~ unfi is useful only if we assume the Axiom of Infinity (see comments in ~ fin2inf ). (Contributed by NM, 22-Oct-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: difinf
blocks.content: An infinite set ` A ` minus a finite set is infinite. (Contributed by FL, 3-Aug-2009.)

thm difinf(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wcel(c1, cfn)), wn(wcel(cdif(c0, c1), cfn)))
} = {
  impcom(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wcel(c1, cfn), wn(wcel(cdif(c0, c1), cfn)))
  con3d(wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cdif(c0, c1), cfn))
  expcom(wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(cdif(c0, c1), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn))
  syl(wa(wcel(cdif(c0, c1), cfn), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cun(cdif(c0, c1), c1), cfn))
  unfi(cdif(c0, c1), c1)
  sylbi(wcel(cun(cdif(c0, c1), c1), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cun(c0, c1), cfn))
  eleq1i(cun(cdif(c0, c1), c1), cfn, cun(c0, c1))
  undif1(c0, c1)
  simpld(wcel(cun(c0, c1), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cfn))
  unfir(c0, c1)
}

thm difinf(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ ((¬¨ c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Fin)‚Üí ¬¨(c0 \ c1)‚àà Fin)
} = {
  impcom(¬¨ c0 ‚àà Fin, c1 ‚àà Fin, ¬¨(c0 \ c1)‚àà Fin)
  con3d(c1 ‚àà Fin, c0 ‚àà Fin, (c0 \ c1)‚àà Fin)

  syl(((c0 \ c1)‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà Fin), c0 ‚àà Fin, ((c0 \ c1)‚ãÉ c1)‚àà Fin)
  unfi((c0 \ c1), c1)
  sylbi(((c0 \ c1)‚ãÉ c1)‚àà Fin, c0 ‚àà Fin, (c0 ‚ãÉ c1)‚àà Fin)
  eleq1i(((c0 \ c1)‚ãÉ c1), cfn, (c0 ‚ãÉ c1))
  undif1(c0, c1)
  simpld((c0 ‚ãÉ c1)‚àà Fin, c0 ‚àà Fin, c1 ‚àà Fin)

blocks.name: xpfi
blocks.content: The Cartesian product of two finite sets is finite. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.)

  pm2.27(wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(cxp(cdif(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs3))), c1), cfn))

  ad2antlr(wcel(cv(hs1), cfn), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(cv(hs3), cv(hs1)), wcel(cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1), cfn))
  mpdan(wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1), cfn), wbr(cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1), cen, c1))
  syl3anc(wcel(c1, cfn), wbr(cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1), cen, c1), wcel(cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1), universe), wcel(c1, cfn), wf1o(cres(c2nd, cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1)), cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1), c1))
  mpan(wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1), universe), wcel(csn(cv(hs3)), universe))
  snex(cv(hs3))
  xpexg(csn(cv(hs3)), universe, c1, cfn)

  f1oen2g(cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1), universe, c1, cfn, cres(c2nd, cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1)))
  enfii(c1, cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1))
  syl5(wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cfn), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cv(hs3), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cxp(cdif(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs3))), c1), cfn), wcel(cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1), cfn)), wcel(cxp(cv(hs1), c1), cfn), wcel(cun(cxp(cdif(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs3))), c1), cxp(csn(cv(hs3)), c1)), cfn))

blocks.name: 3xpfi
blocks.content: The Cartesian product of three finite sets is a finite set. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 11-Mar-2018.)

blocks.name: domunfican
blocks.content: A finite set union cancellation law for dominance. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 19-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 5-May-2015.)

blocks.name: infcntss
blocks.content: Every infinite set has a denumerable subset. Similar to Exercise 8 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 91. (However, we need neither AC nor the Axiom of Infinity because of the way we express "infinite" in the antecedent.) (Contributed by NM, 23-Oct-2004.)

blocks.name: prfi
blocks.content: An unordered pair is finite. (Contributed by NM, 22-Aug-2008.)

blocks.name: tpfi
blocks.content: An unordered triple is finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: fiint
blocks.content: Equivalent ways of stating the finite intersection property. We show two ways of saying, "the intersection of elements in every finite nonempty subcollection of ` A ` is in ` A ` ". This theorem is applicable to a topology, which (among other axioms) is closed under finite intersections. Some texts use the left-hand version of this axiom and others the right-hand version, but as our proof here shows, their "intuitively obvious" equivalence can be non-trivial to establish formally. (Contributed by NM, 22-Sep-2002.)

blocks.name: fnfi
blocks.content: A version of ~ fnex for finite sets that does not require Replacement. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Nov-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fnfi(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(c0, cfn))
} = {
  eqeltrrd(c0, cfn, cres(c0, c1), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)))
  adantr(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn), wceq(cres(c0, c1), c0))
  fnresdm(c0, c1)
  anabsi7(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(cres(c0, c1), cfn))
  findcard2(hs0, hs1, hs2, c1, wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, c1), cfn)), wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn)), wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, emptycls), cfn)), wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cfn)), wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), cfn)))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn), wcel(cres(c0, emptycls), cfn))
  eleq1d(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn, cres(c0, emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls))
  reseq2(cv(hs0), emptycls, c0)
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cfn))
  eleq1d(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn, cres(c0, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))

  eleq1d(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn, cres(c0, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))

  res0(c0)

  syl5eqel(cres(c0, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), cfn, cun(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cres(c0, csn(cv(hs2)))), wa(wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cfn), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn))))
  resundi(c0, cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))

blocks.name: fodomfi
blocks.content: An onto function implies dominance of domain over range, for finite sets. Unlike ~ fodom for arbitrary sets, this theorem does not require the Axiom of Choice for its proof. (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 16-Nov-2014.)

blocks.name: fodomfib
blocks.content: Equivalence of an onto mapping and dominance for a nonempty finite set. Unlike ~ fodomb for arbitrary sets, this theorem does not require the Axiom of Choice for its proof. (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm fodomfib(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfn), wb(wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wex(s0, wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1))), wa(wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1), wbr(c1, cdom, c0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  impbid(wcel(c0, cfn), wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wex(s0, wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1))), wa(wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1), wbr(c1, cdom, c0)))
  expimpd(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls), wex(s0, wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1)), wa(wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1), wbr(c1, cdom, c0)))
  exlimdv(s0, wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1), wa(wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1), wbr(c1, cdom, c0)))
  jcad(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1), wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1), wbr(c1, cdom, c0))
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1), wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1))
  mpbird(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1)), wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1), wne(c1, emptycls))
  adantll(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls), wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1), wne(c1, emptycls))
  biimpac(wne(c0, emptycls), wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1), wne(c1, emptycls))
  necon3bid(c0, emptycls, c1, emptycls, wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1))
  bitr3d(wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1), wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls), wceq(cdm(cv(s0)), emptycls))
  eqeq1d(cdm(cv(s0)), emptycls, c0, wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1))
  fdmd(cv(s0), c0, c1, wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1))
  fof(cv(s0), c0, c1)
  syl5bb(wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1), wceq(cdm(cv(s0)), emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls), wceq(crn(cv(s0)), emptycls))
  dm0rn0(cv(s0))
  eqeq1d(crn(cv(s0)), emptycls, c1, wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1))
  adantlr(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls), wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1), wb(wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1), wne(c1, emptycls)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1)), wb(wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1), wne(c1, emptycls)), wcel(c1, universe))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1), wcel(c1, universe))
  syl6eqelr(c1, universe, crn(cv(s0)), wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1))
  forn(cv(s0), c0, c1)
  rnex(cv(s0))
  vex(s0)
  0sdomg(c1, universe)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls), wi(wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1), wbr(c1, cdom, c0)))
  ex(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1), wbr(c1, cdom, c0))
  fodomfi(c0, cv(s0), c1)
  jca2(wcel(c0, cfn), wa(wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1), wbr(c1, cdom, c0)), wne(c0, emptycls), wex(s0, wfo(cv(s0), c0, c1)))
  syl5ib(wcel(c0, cfn), wa(wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1), wbr(c1, cdom, c0)), wne(c0, emptycls), wbr(emptycls, csdm, c0))
  sdomdomtr(emptycls, c1, c0)
  0sdomg(c0, cfn)
  fodomr(s0, c1, c0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cfn)
  diff.cfn.s(s0)
  diff.wne.s(s0, c0, emptycls)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wbr(emptycls, csdm, c1), wbr(c1, cdom, c0))
  diff.wbr.s(s0, emptycls, csdm, c1)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.csdm.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, c1, cdom, c0)
  diff.cdom.s(s0)
}

  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚Üí((c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÉ(s0,(s0 : c0 ‚Ü† c1)))‚Üî(‚àÖ[‚â∫]c1 ‚àß c1[‚âº]c0)))

  impbid(c0 ‚àà Fin, (c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÉ(s0,(s0 : c0 ‚Ü† c1))), (‚àÖ[‚â∫]c1 ‚àß c1[‚âº]c0))

  adantll(c0 ‚àà Fin, c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ, (s0 : c0 ‚Ü† c1), c1 ‚â† ‚àÖ)
  biimpac(c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ, (s0 : c0 ‚Ü† c1), c1 ‚â† ‚àÖ)

  fdmd(s0, c0, c1, (s0 : c0 ‚Ü† c1))

  syl5bb((s0 : c0 ‚Ü† c1), dom(s0)= ‚àÖ, c1 = ‚àÖ, ran(s0)= ‚àÖ)
  dm0rn0(s0)
  eqeq1d(ran(s0), emptycls, c1, (s0 : c0 ‚Ü† c1))
  adantlr(c0 ‚àà Fin, c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ, (s0 : c0 ‚Ü† c1), (‚àÖ[‚â∫]c1 ‚Üî c1 ‚â† ‚àÖ))
  syl((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(s0 : c0 ‚Ü† c1)), (‚àÖ[‚â∫]c1 ‚Üî c1 ‚â† ‚àÖ), c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  adantl(c0 ‚àà Fin, (s0 : c0 ‚Ü† c1), c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  syl6eqelr(c1, universe, ran(s0), (s0 : c0 ‚Ü† c1))
  forn(s0, c0, c1)
  rnex(s0)

  syl5ib(c0 ‚àà Fin, (‚àÖ[‚â∫]c1 ‚àß c1[‚âº]c0), c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ, ‚àÖ[‚â∫]c0)

blocks.name: fofinf1o
blocks.content: Any surjection from one finite set to another of equal size must be a bijection. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Aug-2014.)

  mpd(wa(wa(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wbr(c1, cen, c2), wcel(c2, cfn)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wn(wbr(c2, cdom, cdif(c1, csn(cv(hs1))))))
  nsyl3(wa(wa(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wbr(c1, cen, c2), wcel(c2, cfn)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))), wbr(c2, cdom, cdif(c1, csn(cv(hs1)))), wbr(cdif(c1, csn(cv(hs1))), csdm, c2))

blocks.name: dmfi
blocks.content: The domain of a finite set is finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: fundmfibi
blocks.content: A function is finite if and only if its domain is finite. (Contributed by AV, 10-Jan-2020.)

blocks.name: resfnfinfin
blocks.content: The restriction of a function to a finite set is finite. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Feb-2018.)

blocks.name: residfi
blocks.content: A restricted identity function is finite iff the restricting class is finite. (Contributed by AV, 10-Jan-2020.)

blocks.name: cnvfi
blocks.content: If a set is finite, its converse is as well. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: rnfi
blocks.content: The range of a finite set is finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: f1dmvrnfibi
blocks.content: A one-to-one function whose domain is a set is finite if and only if its range is finite. See also ~ f1vrnfibi . (Contributed by AV, 10-Jan-2020.)

  impcom(wcel(c0, c1), wf1(c2, c0, c3), wa(wcel(cdm(c2), c1), wf1o(c2, cdm(c2), crn(c2))))

blocks.name: f1vrnfibi
blocks.content: A one-to-one function which is a set is finite if and only if its range is finite. See also ~ f1dmvrnfibi . (Contributed by AV, 10-Jan-2020.)

blocks.name: fofi
blocks.content: If a function has a finite domain, its range is finite. Theorem 37 of [Suppes] p. 104. (Contributed by NM, 25-Mar-2007.)

blocks.name: f1fi
blocks.content: If a 1-to-1 function has a finite codomain its domain is finite. (Contributed by FL, 31-Jul-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: iunfi
blocks.content: The finite union of finite sets is finite. Exercise 13 of [Enderton] p. 144. This is the indexed union version of ~ unifi . Note that ` B ` depends on ` x ` , i.e. can be thought of as ` B ( x ) ` . (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm iunfi(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, cfn))), wcel(ciun(s0, c0, c1), cfn))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

blocks.name: unifi
blocks.content: The finite union of finite sets is finite. Exercise 13 of [Enderton] p. 144. (Contributed by NM, 22-Aug-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: unifi2
blocks.content: The finite union of finite sets is finite. Exercise 13 of [Enderton] p. 144. This version of ~ unifi is useful only if we assume the Axiom of Infinity (see comments in ~ fin2inf ). (Contributed by NM, 11-Mar-2006.)

thm unifi2(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com))), wbr(cuni(c0), csdm, com))

} = {
  mpbid(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com))), wbr(cuni(c0), csdm, com), wcel(cuni(c0), cfn))
  syl2an(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com)), wcel(cuni(c0), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn), wss(c0, cfn))
  isfinite2(c0)
  sylibr(wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com)), wss(c0, cfn), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cfn)))
  ralimi(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com), wcel(cv(s0), cfn))
  isfinite2(cv(s0))
  dfss3(s0, c0, cfn)
  unifi(c0)
  syl(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com))), wb(wcel(cuni(c0), cfn), wbr(cuni(c0), csdm, com)), wcel(com, universe))
  adantr(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com)), wcel(com, universe))
  fin2inf(c0)
  isfiniteg(cuni(c0))
  diff.cfn.s(s0)
}

  adantr(c0[‚â∫]_om, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, s0[‚â∫]_om), _om ‚àà ùïå)

blocks.name: infssuni
blocks.content: If an infinite set ` A ` is included in the underlying set of a finite cover ` B ` , then there exists a set of the cover that contains an infinite number of element of ` A ` . (Contributed by FL, 2-Aug-2009.)

  syl(wa(wcel(c1, cfn), wral(s0, c1, wcel(cin(c0, cv(s0)), cfn))), wi(wss(c0, cuni(c1)), wi(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wrex(s0, c1, wn(wcel(cin(c0, cv(s0)), cfn))))), wcel(ciun(s0, c1, cin(c0, cv(s0))), cfn))

  iunin2(s0, c1, c0, cv(s0))
  sylbi(wcel(cin(c0, ciun(s0, c1, cv(s0))), cfn), wi(wss(c0, cuni(c1)), wi(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wrex(s0, c1, wn(wcel(cin(c0, cv(s0)), cfn))))), wcel(cin(c0, cuni(c1)), cfn))
  eleq1i(cin(c0, ciun(s0, c1, cv(s0))), cfn, cin(c0, cuni(c1)))

  sylbi(wss(c0, cuni(c1)), wi(wcel(cin(c0, cuni(c1)), cfn), wi(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wrex(s0, c1, wn(wcel(cin(c0, cv(s0)), cfn))))), wceq(cin(c0, cuni(c1)), c0))

blocks.name: unirnffid
blocks.content: The union of the range of a function from a finite set into the class of finite sets is finite. Deduction form. (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm unirnffid(class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cuni(crn(c0)), cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfn))
} = {
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(cuni(crn(c0)), cfn), wcel(crn(c0), cfn), wss(crn(c0), cfn))
  syl(w0, wcel(crn(c0), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn))
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(c0, cfn), wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn))
  ffnd(c0, c1, cfn, w0)
  fnfi(c0, c1)
  rnfi(c0)
  frnd(c0, cfn, c1, w0)
  unifi(crn(c0))
}

  mp1i(wa(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, cfn)), wss(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), cdm(c0)), wss(cres(c0, c1), c0))

blocks.name: pwfi
blocks.content: The power set of a finite set is finite and vice-versa. Theorem 38 of [Suppes] p. 104 and its converse, Theorem 40 of [Suppes] p. 105. (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-2007.)
blocks.origin:
thm pwfi(class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cpw(c0), cfn))

blocks.name: mapfi
blocks.content: Set exponentiation of finite sets is finite. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: ixpfi
blocks.content: A Cartesian product of finitely many finite sets is finite. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: ixpfi2
blocks.content: A Cartesian product of finite sets such that all but finitely many are singletons is finite. (Note that ` B ( x ) ` and ` D ( x ) ` are both possibly dependent on ` x ` .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jan-2015.)

  mpan2(c0 ‚àà Fin, dom((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))‚àà Fin, dom((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))‚äÜ c0)
  dmmptss(s0, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1), c0, c1)

}

blocks.name: abrexfi
blocks.content: An image set from a finite set is finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Feb-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm abrexfi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1))), cfn))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl5eqelr(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1))), cfn, crn(cmpt(s1, c0, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn))
  rnmpt(s0, s1, cmpt(s1, c0, c1), c0, c1)
  eqid(cmpt(s1, c0, c1))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(crn(cmpt(s1, c0, c1)), cfn), wcel(cmpt(s1, c0, c1), cfn))
  mptfi(s1, c0, c1)
  rnfi(cmpt(s1, c0, c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm abrexfi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚Üí { s0 | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c0, s0 = c1)} ‚àà Fin)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl5eqelr({ s0 | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c0, s0 = c1)}, cfn, ran((s1 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1)), c0 ‚àà Fin)
  rnmpt(s0, s1, (s1 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1), c0, c1)
  eqid((s1 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))
  syl(c0 ‚àà Fin, ran((s1 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))‚àà Fin, (s1 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1)‚àà Fin)
  mptfi(s1, c0, c1)
  rnfi((s1 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c1))
}

blocks.name: cnvimamptfin
blocks.content: A preimage of a mapping with a finite domain under any class is finite. In contrast to ~ fisuppfi , the range of the mapping needs not to be known. (Contributed by AV, 21-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: elfpw
blocks.content: Membership in a class of finite subsets. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 4-Apr-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: unifpw
blocks.content: A set is the union of its finite subsets. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm unifpw(class c0) {
  |- wceq(cuni(cin(cpw(c0), cfn)), c0)
} = {

  unissi(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), cpw(c0))
  inss1(cpw(c0), cfn)
  unipw(c0)

  snidg(cv(hs0), c0)

}

blocks.name: fissuni

blocks.name: fipreima
blocks.content: Given a finite subset ` A ` of the range of a function, there exists a finite subset of the domain whose image is ` A ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fipreima(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wss(c2, crn(c0)), wcel(c2, cfn)), wrex(s0, cin(cpw(c1), cfn), wceq(cima(c0, cv(s0)), c2)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  exlimddv(hs0, w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wss(c2, crn(c0)), wcel(c2, cfn)), wrex(s0, cin(cpw(c1), cfn), wceq(cima(c0, cv(s0)), c2)), wa(wf(cv(hs0), c2, c1), wral(hs1, c2, wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), cv(hs1)))))
  syl2anc(w3a(wfn(c0, c1), wss(c2, crn(c0)), wcel(c2, cfn)), wex(hs0, wa(wf(cv(hs0), c2, c1), wral(hs1, c2, wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), cv(hs1))))), wcel(c2, cfn), wral(hs1, c2, wrex(hs2, c1, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))))
  simp3(wfn(c0, c1), wss(c2, crn(c0)), wcel(c2, cfn))
  3adant3(wfn(c0, c1), wss(c2, crn(c0)), wcel(c2, cfn), wral(hs1, c2, wrex(hs2, c1, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))))
  biimpa(wfn(c0, c1), wss(c2, crn(c0)), wral(hs1, c2, wrex(hs2, c1, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))))
  syl5bb(wfn(c0, c1), wss(c2, crn(c0)), wral(hs1, c2, wrex(hs2, c1, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs1, c2, wcel(cv(hs1), crn(c0))))
  dfss3(hs1, c2, crn(c0))
  ralbidv(hs1, c2, wfn(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs1), crn(c0)), wrex(hs2, c1, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1))))
  fvelrnb(hs2, c0, c1, cv(hs1))

blocks.name: finsschain
blocks.content: A finite subset of the union of a superset chain is a subset of some element of the chain. A useful preliminary result for ~ alexsub and others. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 25-Jan-2010.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 11-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 18-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm finsschain(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wor(crpss, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cfn), wss(c1, cuni(c0)))), wrex(s0, c0, wss(c1, cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {

blocks.name: indexfi
blocks.content: If for every element of a finite indexing set ` A ` there exists a corresponding element of another set ` B ` , then there exists a finite subset of ` B ` consisting only of those elements which are indexed by ` A ` . Proven without the Axiom of Choice, unlike ~ indexdom . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 12-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
